definitions.definition: To reach or come to by way of increase; to arise or spring up because of growth or result, especially as the produce of money lent.
To be incurred as a result of the passage of time.
definitions.example: The monthly financial statements show all the actual but only some of the accrued expenses.
He has accrued nine sick days.

definitions.definition: To become an enforceable and permanent right.
Having increased through accrual; having risen over time or due to financial transactions.
